Ad Text:
expertech is partnering with a fast-growing early-stage AI start-up that's building next-generation intelligent products used by global customers. We're looking for a Senior Software Engineer with strong experience in Python, AI, and Machine Learning to join a nimble engineering team.
If you're passionate about solving complex problems, shipping high-quality code, and shaping the future of AI, this role is for you.
 
Responsibilities

Design, build, and scale AI/ML-powered backend services and applications
Develop production-grade software using Python and modern frameworks
Work closely with founders to deploy and optimise ML models
Contribute to architecture decisions for distributed systems and cloud-native platforms
Take ownership of features from concept to deployment in a fast-moving start-up environment
Collaborate in an agile, remote-first team with a strong engineering culture
Tech Stack

Languages: Python (primary), TypeScript (nice to have)
AI/ML: PyTorch, TensorFlow, scikit-learn, model optimisation + deployment
Data: PostgreSQL, Redis, vector databases (Pinecone/FAISS)
Cloud: AWS, Docker, Kubernetes
Tools: GitHub, CI/CD pipelines, modern DevOps workflows
Skills and experience

5+ years of software engineering experience
Strong Python development background
Proven experience building or deploying ML/AI models in production
Solid understanding of algorithms, data structures, and distributed systems
Start-up mindset: proactive, hands-on, comfortable with ambiguity
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
This is a unique Greenfield opportunity to build an AI platform from the ground up and to work fully remotely from home. We are looking for candidates who live on the East Coast of Australia and have eligible working rights to start ASAP.
 
Please apply directly by uploading your resume through the link.

Staff Data Engineer (Oracle, AWS)

You are passionate to stay ahead of the latest AWS Cloud, and Data Lake technologies but well versed in relational databases

We're one of the largest and most advanced Data Engineering teams in the country

Together we can build state-of-the-art data solutions that power seamless experiences for millions of customers




Do work that matters:




As a Staff Data engineer with expertise in data engineering, software development / programming and a passion for building data-driven solutions, you're ahead of trends and work at the forefront of AWS Cloud, AI, and Data warehouse technologies.




Which is why we're the perfect fit for you. Here, you'll be part of a team of engineers going above and beyond to improve the standard of digital banking. Using the latest tech to solve our customers' most complex data-centric problems.




See yourself in our team:




The Data Provisioning and Enrichment team provides data delivery, insights and software delivery outcomes to support Finance Risk and Treasury businesses. We support the Group's strategy of building tomorrow's bank today for our customers, through a focus on three key priorities of trust, resilience and capital generation.




You will be a part of the Mobile and Modernisation Crew, which is responsible for:

Design and delivery of a fully secure mobile customer interface and payment system

Migration and transformation of data from legacy Oracle Database to Cloud Databases (AWS and others), and

Overseeing the delivery of all data outcomes to support payments and

So much more….




We are interested in hearing from people who:

Have built or worked on building out data warehouses or data lakes

Have In-depth knowledge of Oracle Databases (COMMSEE/COMMBIZ experience would be a bonus)

Are familiar with the full software development lifecycle with a focus on data extraction/ingestion processing, data transformation pipelines, data integration and visualisation

Understand data profiling, basics of numerical statistics and data quality calculations

Has experience in handling large-scale data processing and analytics

Can provide code quality control through peer programming, code review and automated pipeline release management

Have strong problem solving and analytical skills

Are experienced in end to end application design

Can coach junior engineers, share knowledge to uplift and improve software development practices




Technical Skills:

We use a broad range of tools, languages, and frameworks. We don't expect you to know them all but experience or exposure with some of these (or equivalents) will set you up for success in this team;




Large and complex Oracle Relational Database experience

ETL and DataLake experience

Are proficient in languages such as Python and SQL

ETL Development: Design, Develop and implement ETL processes using appropriate toolsets

In-depth knowledge of AWS services, especially related to data storage and processing such as S3, RDS, DynamoDB, Redshift, Glue, Athena, EMR, Spark

Knowledge of data architectures such as data vault 2.0

Understanding how AI can be used to solve real-world problems through data pipelines and machine learning lifecycle management

Pipeline Design: Building scalable and efficient data pipelines that support AI model training and inference

AI-Enhanced Automation: Leveraging AI agents to automate and accelerate engineering tasks (highly desirable experience with effective use of Model Context Protocols (MCPs) and automation for DevSecOps)




Working with us




Whether you're passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career with CommBank is for you. Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive, and flexible workplace with flexible work locations.




Here, you'll thrive. You'll be supported when faced with challenges and empowered to tackle new opportunities. We're hiring engineers from across all of Australia and have opened technology hubs in Melbourne and Perth. We really love working here, and we think you will too.




We support our people with the flexibility to balance where work is done with at least half their time each month connecting in office. We also have many other flexible working options available including changing start and finish times, part-time arrangements and job share to name a few. Talk to us about how these arrangements might work in the role you're interested in.




If this sounds like the role for you then we would love to hear from you. Apply today!

Engineering Lead
ASX-Listed FinTech, Sydney Hybrid
Up to $200k + Super + Bonus + LTVI

Overview:

We are looking for a highly capable Engineering Lead to guide and scale a high-performing Data & Machine Learning Engineering team (5–6 engineers). You must also come from a Software Engineering background.

This role blends technical leadership (50%) with hands-on engineering (50%), driving the build of scalable data platforms, ML infrastructure, and API-driven services that power real-time financial products.

You’ll work closely with Product, Data Science, Platform, and broader Engineering to deliver high-quality solutions in a fast-moving FinTech environment.

Key Responsibilities Leadership & Delivery
Lead, mentor and develop a team of 5–6 Data & ML Engineers (mid, senior and principal levels).
Own engineering delivery across data pipelines, ML systems, API services and platform tooling.
Set best practices for coding, design, testing, observability, and deployment.
Drive architectural decisions and ensure scalable, reliable engineering outcomes.
Collaborate with Product, Data Science and business stakeholders to define roadmaps and translate requirements into actionable technical work.
Foster a culture of ownership, learning, high performance and cross-functional collaboration.
Hands-On Engineering (50%)
Build, optimise and deploy data and ML pipelines using Python, AWS, Databricks, and modern orchestration tooling.
Contribute to core API development using Python, Golang or Java.
Participate in code reviews, systems design, and complex technical problem solving.
Build reusable frameworks enabling data scientists to train, deploy and monitor models at scale.
Improve reliability, latency and throughput of online inference systems.
Core Technical Stack
Languages: Python (primary), Golang or Java or similar accepted if not Python.
Cloud: AWS (Lambda, ECS/Fargate, API Gateway, S3, Step Functions, EMR, etc.)
Data Platform: Databricks, Spark, Delta Lake.
MLOps / Infra: MLflow, Docker, CI/CD, Feature Stores, observability tooling.
APIs: RESTful APIs, microservices, real-time data ingestion & online inference.
What We’re Looking For Essential
7+ years in software/data/ML engineering roles with strong hands-on coding ability.
Proven experience leading engineering teams (formal or informal).
Strong background in backend/API engineering with Python, Golang, or Java.
Deep experience building scalable data systems, distributed processing, and productionised ML workflows.
Strong understanding of cloud-native architectures (AWS preferred).
Experience working cross-functionally with Data Science, Product and Platform teams.
Excellent communication, stakeholder management and technical leadership skills.
Nice to Have
Experience in FinTech, lending, payments, or high-throughput consumer platforms.
Previous work on online inference, real-time ML, or event-driven architectures.
Exposure to security, compliance or responsible AI considerations.
Why This Role Is Exciting
Lead and scale the engineering capability behind a rapidly growing real-time FinTech product.
Build next-generation data & ML systems, including online inference and personalised decisioning.
Influence architecture, hiring and long-term technology strategy.
Plenty of room for innovation, autonomy and making a measurable business impact.

At Oracle Health and AI (OHAI), we're not just building the future of healthcare applications - we're redefining it. Our diverse team of visionaries and innovators is at the forefront of cutting-edge AI technology, particularly Generative AI, where creativity meets precision. As pioneers in this space, we've consistently delivered industry-leading AI solutions, notably for the Oracle Clinical Digital Assistant, solidifying our reputation as trusted leaders in the field.

Now, as we expand rapidly, we're channeling our expertise into transformative Generative AI solutions that promise to revolutionize healthcare for millions. Operating within a dynamic, agile environment, we enjoy strong backing from senior leadership and have a clear, impactful mission. Our close partnership with Oracle Cerner enables us to directly influence patient care on a massive scale, driving real change.

As our Senior or  Principal Applied Scientist, you'll be at the heart of this transformation, shaping the future of AI at OHAI. Your expertise in Large Language Models (LLMs) and Generative AI will be crucial in bringing our visionary solutions to life, delivering groundbreaking healthcare applications that will set new standards across the industry.

As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s challenges. We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity. 

We know that true innovation starts when everyone is empowered to contribute. That’s why we’re committed to growing an inclusive workforce that promotes opportunities for all.

Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer competitive benefits based on parity and consistency and support our people with flexible medical, life insurance, and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.

We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by emailing 

accommodation-request_mb@oracle.com or by calling +1 888 404 2494 in the United States.

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law. 

Responsibilities:

Lead the architectural design of AI solutions, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance across complex projects.
Oversee and guide projects from inception to delivery, managing all aspects of the project lifecycle to ensure successful outcomes.
Make strategic decisions that shape the direction of AI projects, contributing to key decisions that are visible to and impact executives.
Work alongside fellow technical leaders to ensure the seamless and timely delivery of sophisticated models, while ensuring their successful integration into our cutting-edge services.
Coordinate with diverse, multinational teams to drive the projects from initial research and proof of concept to full-scale production, ensuring global impact.
Leverage the latest breakthroughs in generative AI, machine learning, and deep learning to create innovative healthcare services and applications that set new industry standards.
Design and review AI solutions with a focus on excellence, employing best practices for data management, model development, and evaluation to ensure the highest quality outcomes.
Lead and mentor a talented team of both junior and senior applied scientists, fostering growth and nurturing the next generation of AI leaders.
Develop production-level code while advocating for the best coding and engineering practices, ensuring robust and scalable AI solutions.
Actively participate in project planning, review, and retrospective sessions, driving continuous improvement and strategic alignment.
Identify potential risks at the critical intersection of business and engineering, and take proactive measures to ensure our plans and executions stay on track.

Qualifications and Experience:

Demonstrated experience in designing and deploying scalable AI models for production, with a track record of success in real-world applications.
Proven experience in leading AI projects from conception to deployment, with a strong track record of delivering innovative solutions that meet business objectives.
Demonstrated ability to manage cross-functional teams, including data scientists, engineers, and stakeholders, to ensure the successful execution of AI initiatives.
Expertise in translating complex technical concepts into actionable strategies, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and timelines.
Exceptional problem-solving skills with the ability to navigate challenges and adapt strategies in fast-paced, evolving environments. 
Deep technical knowledge of Machine Learning and Deep Learning architectures, such as  Transformers, training methodologies, and optimization techniques.
Hands-on experience with the latest advancements in Large Language Models (LLM) and generative AI, including parameter-efficient fine-tuning, instruction fine-tuning, advanced prompt engineering, and Agent technology.
Practical experience with emerging LLM frameworks and plugins such as LangChain, LlamaIndex, VectorStores, Retrievers, LLM Cache, LLMOps (MLFlow), LMQL, and Guidance, showcasing your ability to stay at the forefront of AI technology.
A strong commitment to staying current with the latest advancements in the field, applying cutting-edge academic research to solve complex business challenges, and successfully bringing innovative solutions into production.
A robust publication record, including lead authorship in top-tier journals or conferences, demonstrating thought leadership and a deep understanding of AI research.

Proven experience in leading and mentoring both senior scientists and early-career researchers, fostering a collaborative and innovative team environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge of the healthcare domain and experience in delivering AI models specifically for healthcare applications is highly desirable.
Familiarity with the latest advancements in computer vision and multimodal modelling is a valuable plus.

Education:

A PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Linguistics, or a related field, with a dissertation or final project focused on Machine Learning and Deep Learning, and 3+ years of relevant experience is preferred but not mandatory; OR
A Master’s or Bachelor's degree in a related field with 5+ years of relevant experience is also considered.

Oracle is committed to incorporating generative AI into our applications and workflows for business users. This role presents a unique opportunity to work on pioneering AI technologies and contribute to Oracle's Generative AI strategy. At Oracle, we value diversity and encourage continuous learning for career growth. Come join our team to make a significant difference!

#LI-DNI

Career Level - IC4

About Us:
We are a growing early-stage startup developing an advanced AI-driven education platform. Our mission is to create engaging, intelligent learning experiences powered by modern cloud technologies.

About the Role:
We are seeking a skilled AI Developer with experience in avatar technologies, speech processing, and natural language systems to help us implement intelligent, interactive teaching experiences. This role involves integrating conversational AI with visual avatar systems and cloud-based AI services.

Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and deploy AI avatar components for an interactive learning platform

Integrate AWS-based AI and ML tools (e.g., AWS Lex, Polly, Rekognition, or Bedrock)

Collaborate with our small core team on conversational logic and emotional interaction flows

Optimise avatar realism, responsiveness, and performance across platforms

Support testing, debugging, and documentation

Skills & Experience:

Strong background in AI/ML, NLP, or related fields

Experience with AWS AI services (preferred) or similar platforms (Azure, GCP)

Familiarity with avatar or character systems (e.g., Unreal Metahuman, Unity, NVIDIA Audio2Face, or similar)

Good understanding of speech-to-text and text-to-speech pipelines

Strong problem-solving ability and independence in a startup environment

Why Join Us:

Work directly with a visionary founding team building next-generation education tech

Flexible part-time role with remote work options

Opportunity to shape a product with global potential

If you’re passionate about building cutting-edge AI avatars and want to be part of an early-stage startup doing something meaningful in education, we’d love to hear from you.

To Apply:
Please submit your CV, portfolio (if available), and a brief summary of relevant projects.

Who we are:

Picklebet is a next generation esports, sports and racing betting platform and media brand. Australian owned & operated, we are set to become a major player, both in Australia and internationally.




After continued growth, we are looking to expand our development capabilities, for our in-house technology stack. Joining as part of a growing team, we need smart, and self-motivated people to come along for the ride.




Purpose of this role: 

We are seeking a talented Analytics Engineer to accelerate a culture of data-driven decision making. This crucial role is responsible for enabling self-service analytics, maintaining reliable data flows, and building advanced analytical models and visualisations to uncover new insights. 




The ideal candidate will be a data enthusiast with strong analytical and programming skills who possesses a curious mindset, excellent commercial acumen, and the ability to be a self-starter in our startup environment. Work within the data analytics team, and reporting to the Head of Data and Analytics, you will have the opportunity to own your role and do world-class work.







Responsibilities:

Design and maintain our data warehouse in line with DataOps principles
Manage and expand dashboards, reports and analysis
Optimise and curate our library of BI analytics and metrics
Collaborate with team members to increase their data literacy 
Understand the customers needs and solve problems as they arise
Maintain data governance and stewardship, including data quality rules, documentation and security




Ideally you’ll have:

3+ years experience in Data Analytics/ Engineering with proven experience in designing data models and dashboards, with an emphasis on self-service accessibility
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics or Applied Mathematics would be advantageous, otherwise equivalent experience in a betting company, ecommerce, DTC brand, internet company, or similar
Proficient in platforms; 
SQL (Snowflake, Postgres), dbt
Python
Cloud service management, preferably AWS or GCloud
A modern visualisation tool. Looker or Lightdash preferred
Experience with Turnkey ETL tooling (Fivetran, Estuary, Temporal etc) and Martech platforms (Segment, Braze, Mixpanel, Full Story, GA4)
A solid grasp of software engineering fundamentals, including Git, CICD, and automation
A working knowledge of statistics, machine learning, causal inference or time series analysis
Strong communication skills, particularly with non-technical audiences.
An interest in one or more of the following; betting, esports, gaming, financial markets and/or sports would be beneficial.





Apply today to work with a high calibre team, in a data-driven culture where your insights will be highly valued and acted upon. With flexible and competitive packages, you don’t want to miss out on this opportunity.








PI279871551

Support Data and Analytics Engineer - 6 month Contract 

Flexible work from home arrangements

Location: North Sydney, 2060




ABOUT EG

Ideas are becoming a reality across the EG Australia national network as we deliver a consistent retail strategy in specialist forecourt retailing to our customers. We continue to build and grow, supported by the knowledge and success of EG Group a creative and innovative global retail operation servicing over 6,500 forecourts in 9 countries across Europe, North America and Australia.




ABOUT THE ROLE

As a Support Data & Analytics Engineer, you’ll provide essential reporting and data support for 500+ stores and key business units, including Finance, Operations, Fuel Pricing, Merchandising, Business Assurance, and People & Culture. You’ll manage and resolve ServiceNow support tickets by identifying root causes, re-running pipelines, validating data quality, and working with upstream system owners to fix data or logic issues.

You’ll also perform analytical investigations to detect issues, anomalies, and trends, collaborating closely with the wider EG Australia Support Team to ensure accurate and reliable information management.




RESPONSIBILITIES IN A SNAPSHOT:

Reporting into the Head of Information Management you will:

Monitor and action support tickets daily in the ServiceNow queue, along with investigating the underlying trends and anomalies

Liaise with internal users and escalate more complex issues to senior engineers or development teams

Processing ensuring all data processing is completed in a timely manner to ensure downstream reporting and analytics are up to date

Design, test and implement effective and scalable data pipelines, leveraging cutting-edge tools such as LucidCharts (to design), SQL (to build) and Azure Data Factory (to schedule)

Design, test and implement effective and scalable data pipelines in Azure Data Factor

Enhance and maintain data storage and processing solutions, across data warehouses and data lakes using Azure.

Automate data analysis and reporting processes, utilising various tools and scripts

Support data governance through implementing best practices around code documentation, naming conventions, data glossaries and data mapping

Partner with stakeholders to translate complex business problems into fit-for-purpose and scalable data pipelines and data models, to enable fast and efficient data-driven decision-making




WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

A Bachelor’s degree in Data Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field

4 years of experience in a data engineering or analytics role, with a strong foundation in working with complex data systems

Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with a natural curiosity for digging into data and identifying solutions

Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to engage and manage stakeholders effectively

A proactive and collaborative approach, you work well independently and as part of a team

Proficiency in Snowflake and advanced SQL scripting, along with intermediate skills in a programming language such as Python

Hands-on experience with ETL and scheduling tools like Azure Data Factory, Azure Logic Apps, PowerAutomate, or similar platforms

A solid understanding of data modelling principles, practices, and methodologies

Experience creating and maintaining technical documentation, standards, and best-practice guidance

Demonstrated expertise in database design, Master Data Management (MDM), and building high-performance, scalable data pipelines




WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

An opportunity to play an integral role in driving efficiency and profitability for EG Australia.

Competitive salary package and employee discounts.

Mix of office & working from home flexibility with access to employee well-being programs.

Work with cutting edge analytics & AI tools across Azure, Snowflake and DataIKU.

Equal opportunity workplace with a commitment to diversity & inclusion and gender-diverse policies.

 

Be part of the team shaping operations for EG Australia. Apply Now

LTI Mindtree is seeking an experienced Azure Analytics Data Architect to lead the design and delivery of enterprise-grade Azure data platforms for public sector and large enterprise clients. This role requires strong expertise across Azure analytics services, data engineering best practices, and cloud architectural governance. The ideal candidate will bring deep technical capability, architectural leadership, and the ability to design secure, scalable, and future-ready data ecosystems. Active NV1/NV2 security clearance is mandatory.

Key Responsibilities

Architect and implement end-to-end Azure data solutions spanning ingestion, storage, processing, analytics, and governance.
Define and maintain enterprise-wide Azure data architecture standards that align with security, compliance, and operational frameworks.
Utilize key Azure services such as Microsoft Fabric, Databricks, Synapse Analytics, Data Lake Storage, Data Factory, Cosmos DB, and Azure SQL to deliver high-performing solutions.
Build, optimize, and automate scalable ETL/ELT pipelines using ADF, Synapse, metadata-driven frameworks, and CI/CD practices.
Provide architectural leadership across data modeling, integration workflows, analytics pipelines, and cross-system interoperability.
Implement strong data governance, data quality, identity controls, and privacy protection across Azure environments.
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and application teams to deliver structured, governed, and accessible datasets.
Create and maintain architecture documentation, solution blueprints, and implementation roadmaps.
Ensure architecture alignment with Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF), Well-Architected Framework (WAF), and organizational technology standards.
Drive continuous improvement across performance, reliability, cost optimization, operational excellence, and security posture.
Qualifications

Active NV1/NV2 Security Clearance (mandatory, role cannot be performed without it)
10+ years of experience in Data Architecture, Data Engineering, Cloud Analytics, or enterprise data platform delivery
Deep hands-on expertise with Azure analytics services including Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks, Data Lake, Fabric, Cosmos DB, and Azure SQL
Strong knowledge of data modeling, warehousing concepts, ETL/ELT best practices, and distributed data processing
Experience working with both relational and NoSQL data systems, including PostgreSQL and Cosmos DB
Proven capability in designing scalable, secure, and governed cloud architectures at enterprise scale
Experience with CI/CD, infrastructure-as-code, metadata-driven frameworks, and modern DevOps practices
Exceptional communication, documentation, and stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to convey complex architecture concepts to both technical and business audiences

At LTI Mindtree Australia, you’ll have the opportunity to work on nation-critical transformation programs while being part of a global organization known for innovation, excellence, and a strong Azure data practice. You will join a collaborative team that values technical leadership, continuous learning, and impactful delivery. This is your chance to shape the data landscape for some of the region’s most strategic clients, all while growing your career in a supportive and future-focused environment.

Category:
Consultants (Information & Communication Technology)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
Take the next step in your career with this exciting opportunity within eHealth. The purpose of this role is to manage the development and implementation of large scale and complex technical solutions and provide expert technical advice whilst ensuring alignment with contemporary Information Management (IM)/Information Communication Technology (ICT) frameworks.

What you'll do  

Manage the design, planning and implementation of technical solutions, ensuring alignment with best practice IM/ICT design and delivery frameworks.
Specifies and designs complex systems and recommends appropriate design standards, methods and tools, consistent with agreed enterprise and solution architectures and ensures effective application.
Maintains an in-depth knowledge of technical specialisms and provides expert advice regarding their application.
Manage the development, publication, implementation and compliance of all program/project(s) deliverables and related standards and procedures at an enterprise level.
Lead the assessment, analysis, development, documentation and implementation planning of complex IM/ICT changes, including the evaluation of risks to the integrity of infrastructure inherent in proposed implementations.
Lead a team of specialist technical resources in the delivery of complex technical solutions.

About you  

We are searching for someone who has:

Experience in the management, design, publication, implementation, compliance and delivery of service integration to industry best practice frameworks for large scale, complex IM/ICT program/project(s), preferably in the health care industry (SFIA Skill: ITMG: Level 5, HSIN: Level 4)
Experience designing systems and providing expert knowledge in relevant design standards, techniques and methods and tools for large scale complex organisations (SFIA Skill: DESN: Level 4, METL: 5)
High level of expertise and experience in the following technology domains to analyse, provide technical direction, standardisation, professional advice and support of enterprise ICT services in a large customer focus organisation
Cloud Technologies (AWS, Asure)
Cloud Automation (Asure DevOps, CloudFormation Templates, arm and Bicep Templates)
Microsoft Active Directory & Azure EntraID
Identity & Federation Services
Scripting Languages (PowerShell, Python, Shell, etc)
Microsoft Windows Server and Linux Server (OS)
DNS/DHCP/Group Policy
Demonstrated experience in the assessment, analysis, development, documentation and implementation planning of changes for large complex IM/ICT program/project(s). (SFIA Skill: CHMG: Level 4)
Demonstrated high level analytical, conceptual and problem solving skills with a proven record in the assessment and evaluation of technical requirements within a complex IM/ICT environment.
Well-developed interpersonal, written and oral communication skills including the ability to negotiate, advise, influence others and work collaboratively with people to make decisions. (NHS: Effective and strategic influencing, Collaborative working)

Why work with us?  

Work alongside passionate professionals in a supportive and inclusive environment that values people and prioritises employee success and wellbeing. 

Competitive salaries 

12.75% superannuation  
17.5% leave loading 

Employee wellbeing & development 

Access to 24/7 confidential employee support providers and counsellors including for immediate family members 
Additional flexibility to support your work life balance including access to generous leave entitlements, such as purchased leave, domestic violence leave, reproductive health leave, cultural leave, study and examination leave. 
Access to a variety of programs and initiatives to support training and career growth.  

Our commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion  

At Queensland Health, our work environment is inclusive and supportive, and we value our employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from people of all cultures, abilities and backgrounds.  

Our commitment to cultural safety, equity, diversity and inclusion means we understand some people may need changes to the recruitment process. If you need support during the recruitment process, such as meeting with the panel virtually instead of in person, please reach out to the hiring manager. We value diverse candidates and your need for adjustments will not affect our hiring decisions.  

Ready to apply? 

For further information on how to apply please review the attached Role Description.
